parameters.description: Intrinsic outbreak growth rate of COTS (year^-1). Literature/expert estimate.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Crown-of-thorns starfish population exponential growth dynamics

parameters.description: Decay rate of COTS post-outbreak (year^-1). Influences the bust phase.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Population collapse mechanism in marine ecosystem outbreak cycles

parameters.description: Predation efficiency of COTS on coral species (m2/individual). Based on expert opinion.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Quantitative measure of starfish destructive impact on coral reefs

parameters.description: Carrying capacity for COTS (individuals/m2). Determines saturation level in the ecosystem.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Maximum sustainable population density for marine predator species

parameters.description: Standard deviation for lognormal observation error (log-scale). Fixed minimum to ensure numerical stability.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Statistical uncertainty and variability in ecological population measurements

parameters.description: Controls outbreak trigger steepness; higher values yield a more threshold-like response capturing outbreak initiation dynamics.
parameters.source: model refinement based on ecological feedback
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Sensitivity of outbreak initiation relative to predator density

parameters.description: Handling time for coral predation: accounts for the saturating functional response in COTS predation on coral. A lower value implies quicker handling, leading to less saturation.
parameters.source: model refinement based on ecological feedback
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Non-linear saturation in predation dynamics due to handling time

parameters.description: Modifier for outbreak trigger steepness representing environmental influences (e.g. temperature anomalies) on outbreak timing.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Multiplicative factor modulating the outbreak trigger based on environmental conditions

parameters.description: Scales coral predation efficiency to reflect reduced effectiveness at low coral cover, representing diminishing returns in prey detection or availability.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Non-linear modulation of coral predation efficiency based on coral cover

parameters.description: Modifier scaling coral recovery rates based on favorable environmental conditions (e.g., water quality, temperature).
parameters.source: model refinement based on ecological feedback
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Environmental influence on coral recovery dynamics, capturing variable ecosystem resilience

parameters.description: Inhibition factor on coral recovery due to sustained high COTS pressure. This factor reduces the recovery rate of corals when high COTS numbers persist, capturing delayed ecosystem resilience.
parameters.source: model refinement based on ecological feedback
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Modulates coral recovery in response to prolonged high predation pressure

parameters.description: Scaling factor that modulates coral recovery rates based on environmental conditions (e.g., water temperature, nutrients). It captures how favorable or unfavorable conditions affect coral resilience.
parameters.source: model refinement based on ecological feedback
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Dynamic adjustment of coral recovery rates in response to environmental variability

parameters.description: Threshold fraction of carrying capacity at which an outbreak is triggered. This parameter allows tuning the outbreak onset in response to variable ecological conditions.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Flexible threshold for triggering COTS outbreaks based on relative carrying capacity

parameters.description: Scaling factor that modulates the effect of coral availability on COTS growth through a saturating functional response, capturing diminishing returns as coral cover increases.
parameters.source: model refinement based on ecological feedback
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Modulates COTS growth via a Michaelis–Menten type resource limitation effect

parameters.description: Exponent for non-linear outbreak decline. Values > 1 intensify the population collapse during outbreak phases, capturing stronger density-dependent effects.
parameters.source: model refinement based on ecological feedback
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Non-linear amplification of outbreak decline dynamics

parameters.description: Exponent for non-linear scaling of coral predation efficiency. Values >1 amplify the impact of coral cover, capturing threshold dynamics in COTS predation.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Modulates the non-linear impact of coral cover on COTS predation rates

parameters.description: Exponent controlling non-linear outbreak trigger sensitivity. Values > 1 increase the sharpness of outbreak onset.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Reflects the sensitivity of outbreak dynamics to surpassing the critical threshold, leading to a rapid outbreak once exceeded

parameters.description: Additional multiplier on outbreak sharpness when environmental conditions are extreme, capturing non-linear amplification of outbreak triggers under atypical conditions.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Multiplier for amplifying outbreak trigger sensitivity during extreme environmental conditions

parameters.description: Coefficient for the quadratic term in the saturating function of coral availability. This parameter captures the non-linear diminishing returns of increased coral cover on COTS resource uptake.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Non-linear modulation of resource limitation by coral availability

parameters.description: Hysteresis effect in outbreak dynamics to capture delayed decline post-outbreak by maintaining outbreak conditions longer.
parameters.source: model refinement incorporating delayed feedback mechanisms
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Captures persistence in outbreak conditions due to inertia in system response

parameters.description: Additional non-linear amplification factor in the outbreak trigger. Captures accelerated outbreak initiation at high COTS densities.
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Non-linear acceleration factor for outbreak trigger function modeling abrupt outbreak dynamics

parameters.description: Modifier representing short-term environmental variability (e.g., temperature fluctuations) affecting the outbreak trigger sensitivity.
parameters.source: model refinement based on ecological feedback
parameters.enhanced_semantic_description: Environmental variability factor modulating outbreak dynamics to capture transient fluctuations in ecosystem conditions
